@Module.Name: Predict
@Module.Description: This module is a prediction model, predicting what will appear after clicking each components on current screen

@Module.Name: Select
@Module.Description: This module is a selection model, selecting the 5 possible component without relativity ranking to be acted on catering to user's intent
@Module.Note: This individual module only select 5 highly related components,without ranking them,and without analyzing the correctness of the components aligning with user's content

Output.<div id=11 class='' > Manage notificatio: The 'Manage notifications' div could lead us to the notification settings of Gmail. Therefore, it's the most likely component to be interacted with.
Output.<button id=14 class='' description='More: The 'More options' button might offer additional settings related to notifications.
Output.<div id=3 class='android:id/checkbox' >: This is a checkbox which generally can be used to turn on or off settings. It's possible that this checkbox could be related to notification settings.
Output.<div id=7 class='android:id/checkbox' >: Similar to the third selection, this is another checkbox that might be used to turn on or off settings, which could possibly be used for turning on notifications.
Output.<div id=10 class='android:id/checkbox' >: Like previous checkboxes, this may be tied to a notifications setting and would need to be interacted with to turn on the notifications.

@Module.Name: Plan
@Module.Description: This module is a plan module, planning the next action based on the selected components, whether click or edit

@Module.Name: Evaluate
@Module.Description: This module is an evaluation module, evaluating the selected components of their contribution to fulfilling the user's intent

@Module.Name: Decide
@Module.Description: This module is a decision module, deciding the final action based on the evaluation result, whether complete or wrong or go on
